thread.title: Delta Skymark deal could boost Japan flights
thread.title_full: Delta Skymark deal could boost Japan flights

author: Carla Caldwell
title: Delta Skymark deal could boost Japan flights
text: Delta Skymark deal could boost Japan flights Jul 14, 2015, 6:29am EDT Byron E. Small A Delta Air Lines Inc. plane fueling. Delta Air Lines Inc. (NYSE: DAL) is interested in investing in Japanâ€™s bankrupt Skymark Airlines Inc. as part of a restructuring plan for the budget carrier, a Japan newspaper is reporting. Such a deal would could give Atlanta-based Delta a foothold in the market for flights within Japan, reports Nikkei Asian Review. Delta, which lacks a Japanese partner in its SkyTeam alliance, does not have code-sharing partners for Japanese domestic flights. The airline has tried to capture demand by operating its own connecting flights from Japan to other cities in Asia, the paper says. Related Content
